TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit PageRange extends System.ValueType

remarks.format: ## Remarks PageRange defines a range of pages that should be processed in an operation such as printing.

MemberSignature.Value: public PageRange (int page);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 page) cil managed

Docs.param: The page that is printed or processed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that includes only the single specified page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `page` parameter value is 1-based; page number 1 is the first page.

MemberSignature.Value: public PageRange (int pageFrom, int pageTo);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 pageFrom, int32 pageTo) cil managed

Docs.param: The first page of the range.
The last page of the range.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified first and last pages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `pageFrom` and `PageTo` parameter values are 1-based; page number 1 is the first page.
Since the range includes both the "from" and "to" pages, the total number of pages is "<xref:System.Windows.Controls.PageRange.PageTo%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PageRange.PageFrom%2A> + 1".

.property instance int32 PageFrom

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page number of the first page in the range.
Docs.value: The 1-based page number of the first page in the range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The PageFrom property is 1-based; page number 1 is the first page.

.property instance int32 PageTo

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page number of the last page in the range.
Docs.value: The 1-based page number of the last page in the range.
